text: Submittals for system components (insulation, mesh, base coat, finish coat, fasteners) approved
EIFS installer certified by manufacturer
Pre-construction meeting completed with trades, GC, consultant
Mock-up panel approved (if required)
Wall substrate (e.g., sheathing) dry, clean, structurally sound
Fasteners flush and no protruding nails, screws, or damage
Control and expansion joint layout verified per drawings
WRB installed continuously with minimum 100 mm laps
All window/door openings wrapped and sealed with waterproof membrane
Sill flashing and pan flashing at rough openings completed before EIFS
Mesh or membrane embedded across sheathing joints (if required by system)
Insulation boards of approved thickness and type
Adhesive applied with full coverage or ribbons as per manufacturer
Boards installed with staggered vertical joints, tight, and level
No gaps >2 mm between boards; foam applied at gaps and tooled
Mechanical fasteners used where required (especially over CMU)
Termination at grade min. 200 mm above finished grade unless otherwise specified
Reinforcing mesh fully embedded in wet base coat
Mesh overlaps a minimum of 65 mm (2.5”)
Backwrap at terminations (top, bottom, openings) and edges completed
Corner mesh installed at all external corners
Additional high-impact mesh at vulnerable locations (ground level, doors, etc.)
Base coat thickness checked as per spec (typically 1.5–3 mm)
Surface cleaned and dry before finish coat application
Finish coat applied uniformly with no visible mesh or patch marks
Finish color and texture matches approved mock-up or sample
Finish coat protected from rain until fully cured
All terminations sealed and weeps installed at base of wall
Sealant joints between EIFS and dissimilar materials completed
Flashings visible and integrated with water-resistive barrier
QA/QC inspection completed and photos taken prior to scaffolding removal
Manufacturer warranty and install logbook submitted (if required)

id: • EIMA / ASTM E2568, E2273 – EIFS Components & Drainage Systems
• Manufacturer Guidelines: Dryvit, Sto, Senergy, Parex
• LEED / Energy Code (if continuous insulation required)
